comment: Calc II. He has been at SPSU since the dinosaurs roamed the earth. He drinks iced coffee drinks, but thinks Coke is pointless. I remember this fact from like 2 years ago, but ask me to do an integral? His digressions are pointless, but somewhat amusing. I got a 'D'. I bombed the final because he rushed the last sections and yes, it was on final!!!!
Good mathematician and professor. Works problems and will answer questions well. Learned lots from his class about calculus and differential equations and now use them in other engineering classes.

He will talk about a lot of aplication stuff that doesn't go with the class, but if you can weed through that you will know everything for the exam.  Furthermore he has helpful hand outs and practic test that are life savers.  Without them his tests would be very difficult.

ok he is a bit boring, but he has a dry humor.  kind of talks to himself rather than to the students.  but his tests are easy.  he gives you past tests and he goes over hw problems every day.  you dont even have to do the homework, he shows it to you.  easy A
Quite boring, always kept us 15 minutes over class time.  Overall, better then many math profs I've had.  Grades tests very leniently.  If you study the past tests, you should get an A.

He's a pretty difficult teacher. But he definitely helps you understand what you're doing. He teaches pretty closely with the text which makes it easy to follow and study for tests. Tells you what you'll be tested on etc. Listen and you'll get an A. Very organized/straightforward. Definitely one of the best teachers I've had at spsu.
Looong lengthy lectures. Not much help, he never in his office. Test nothing like study materials, over 2/3 my class dropped. somehow i passed.

Very dry sense of humor (I love it!). He's very straightforward with what he expects. I thought he was pretty lenient with test corrections; but he does not curve.  Don't get him going on LaPlace transforms or the table of elements (you've been warned! :)

i must say that he is boring.. he talks to the board most of the time and the only time he pays attention to u is when u ask him a question, he doesnt even stop and ask the students if u undestand it or f u have a question.. i got an A in his class, his tests are easy and pretty much the same thing as his practice tests..
Kind of a weird guy, but he knows his stuff and really helps you to visualize what you are doing.
He teaches with his own methods and makes the class sound like a long lecture; however, if you study his online sample tests and study your past tests for the final, you will be just fine.
Very dry, boring, loves math. Don't talk in his class and study the online review and you'll make a B. Test are almost identical to the review.

Do the homework and come to class (or get the notes), and the tests are easy. The tests are usually the simpler problems in the homework. Does not grade homework or take attendance as a grade. Somewhat boring, but knows his stuff.

it does take a while to understand where he is coming from, if you have never had one of his classes. Once you do, however, everything becomes clearer. Outstanding teacher, huge knowledge base, unorthodox teaching style...but one worth taking.

May take time to get used to his methods. Very clear speaker and I felt that he truly wanted his students to do well. Gives sample test and is very helpful if you show interest in the class. Get to omit 1-2 quest on each test, and final was my highest grade. A in course.

He is a very boring professor. I found it very hard to stay awake and learn in his class.  He also teaches the class like everyone is at his level of understanding, so if you have trouble with calculus he will move too fast for you.  His methods of teaching and testing almost make me think that he wants to see people fail.  He is also very strange.

Presents the material clear and very understandable.  You have to do your homework to be able to do his tests in this class.  Tests were moderate, final was very hard.  If you get through his class, you will know the material from now on.

Rather Boring. If he makes non-math comments they reflect that he hasn't much of a life. Tests are hard, but it's nice to be able to omit one problem from each section. Study, do the homework, and you'll do fine.

I thought this class was just calculus with Linear Algebra. It's more like Calculus 4. He knows his stuff, but is a little strange. Not the most outgoing communicative math teacher out there. Just pay attention and do your homework every once in a while. An easy A.

How 'bout a course in speed calculus.  Too fast for me.  He knows his stuff but that doesn't help those that are learning for the first time.  His attitude...if you can't learn this too bad.  Will avoid at all cost any class taught by him.

Repeats himself a lot, and is very monotone and hard to listen to. He knows his stuff.  His tests are tough, but not hard.  The thing that is hard is his grading.  Everything is a "Major Mistake" and counts off big time.
This guy is hard as crap.  He isn't a good teacher, his test are SO HARD! If you already know the material you wont have too much trouble.  But, if calc III is new to you, then don't take this guy
this class sucks, and pace only makes it harder.  he does not curve, even though the class avg is failing, and his tests are imposible.
Good and easy professor.
No Comments
